title: About
text:
I am currently developing NLP solutions for low resource languages. I am interested in creating language technology that helps people learn, use, preserve, revitalise, and share their languages.
I am living in Aotearoa New Zealand. It is beautiful, and I am blessed to be here.

title: Timothy Pistotti
text:
I am a PhD candidate at the University of Auckland, where my research focuses on Natural Language Processing (NLP) for low-resource languages. My work aims to develop methods that enable language technologies to function effectively for the vast number of languages that lack large-scale data resources.
My primary interests include cross-lingual transfer learning, computational syntax, and the intersection of linguistics and machine learning.

title: Timothy Pistotti
text:
Featured Publications


I recently presented two papers at BriGap-2, the second workshop on Bridges and Gaps between Formal and Computational Linguistics, held Sept 2025 in Düsseldorf.
1. Evaluating The Impact of Stimulus Quality in Investigations of {LLM} Language Performance
2. Exploring Gaps in the APS: Direct Minimal Pair Analysis in LLM Syntactic Assessments
Thanks to Jason Brown and Michael Witbrok, my Co-Authors on these papers.
For a complete list, please see my Google Scholar profile.

title: Timothy Pistotti
text:
Upcoming Work
I will be giving an online presentation for the second UncertaiNLP workshop to be held at EMNLP 2025 in Suzhou, China. More details to come…

title: Publications
text:
Qiming Bao, Juho Leinonen, Alex Yuxuan Peng, Wanjun Zhong, Gaël Gendron, Timothy Pistotti, Alice Huang, Paul Denny, Michael Witbrock, and Jiamou Liu. 2025. Exploring iterative enhancement for improving learnersourced multiple-choice question explanations with large language models. In Proceedings of the AAAI conference on artificial intelligence, volume 39, pages 28955–28963.


Qiming Bao, Juho Leinonen, Alex Yuxuan Peng, Wanjun Zhong, Tim Pistotti, Alice Huang, Paul Denny, Michael Witbrock, and Jiamou Liu. 2023a. Exploring self-reinforcement for improving learnersourced multiple-choice question explanations with large language models. arXiv preprint arXiv:2309.10444.


Qiming Bao, Alex Yuxuan Peng, Zhenyun Deng, Wanjun Zhong, Gaël Gendron, Timothy Pistotti, Neset Tan, Nathan Young, Yang Chen, Yonghua Zhu, et al. 2023b. Abstract Meaning Representation-based logic-driven data augmentation for logical reasoning. arXiv preprint arXiv:2305.12599.


Timothy Joseph Pistotti. 2022. Polar questions in Kham Mueang and Standard Thai.


Timothy Pistotti, Jason Brown, and Michael Witbrock. 2025a. Evaluating the impact of stimulus quality in investigations of LLM language performance.


Timothy Pistotti, Jason Brown, and Michael Witbrock. 2025b. Exploring gaps in the APS: Direct minimal pair analysis in LLM syntactic assessments.


Vithya Yogarajan, Gillian Dobbie, Timothy Pistotti, Joshua Bensemann, and Kobe Knowles. 2023. Challenges in annotating datasets to quantify bias in under-represented society. arXiv preprint arXiv:2309.08624.
